snippet: The move, a shift in what American officials had described as a model of international cooperation, came after the Honduran Air Force shot down two planes that might have been carrying drugs.
abstract: United States suspends all sharing of radar intelligence with Honduras in an effort to better control its militarized approach to combat drugs in Central America.

byline.contributor: Charlie Savage contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The move, a shift in what American officials had described as a model of international cooperation, came after the Honduran Air Force shot down two planes that might have been carrying drugs.

headline.seo: U.S. Suspends Antidrug Radar-Sharing With Honduras After Planes Are Downed
headline.main: U.S. Suspends Its Antidrug Radar-Sharing With Honduras
headline.print_headline: U.S. Suspends Its Antidrug Radar-Sharing With Honduras

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
